comments.commentBody:
Th OWS has kept the issue of fair distribution of wealth alive. This message must be carried further so that people understand the reason that the tax they pay may be because there are those with wealth that don't pay their share. There are over 1500 people with earnings above a million $$ that don't pay any wage taxes.
The republicans have done the middle class T partiers a disservice by making them believe their taxes are high because of the poor and welfare instead of the lack of a fair taxation system. The media has also failed to adequately inform the 99% of the problem.
The first step in solving our debt problem is to let the Bush tax cuts expire.
73.5 million rupees is not equal to "about $14,000". It's more like $1.5 million.

The transformation that the areas, addressed by this group, have gone through can only be felt by someone who has frequented those streets 'before' and 'after' the cleaning was done. I do feel a sense of pride when I walk through the clean streets of the city and that pride comes because of the efforts of this 'strange faceless, leaderless group of people'. Hoping that these efforts are replication by people all across the country and the true sense of civic pride is understood.

Great job TUI...!

Delhi is Political Capital of India and Bombay is Financial Capital and Calcutta is
INTELLECTUAL capital of India . Well portrayed by the writer .
Ugly INDIANS are PROUD INDIANS attempting to bring back the PRIDE of&for INDIA.I wish I was young to join this SELFLESS SAMARITAN&SWEET INDIANS.

Calcutta was the capital of India from 1858 to 1911, not from 1750 - 1857 (?) and I believe the move was made from Calcutta to Delhi in 1931. The big blows to the city, were in my opinion (i) the transfer of the capital to Delhi, (ii) 1971 war when close to 10 million refugees fled from East Pakistan and (iii) the most grievous of all, the last 30 years of the communists. The once commercial and cultural capital of India has been left behind.

The comment by Abdul Loya is good but with a major flaw.The transfer of capital took place in 1911 and NOT in 1857.The major cause was the violent anti-British movement launched by Calcuttans against the British plan of dividing Bengal along communal Hindu -Muslim lines.This was a harbinger of the things to come as Calcutt played an enormous role in the anti-colonial freedom struggle that threw the British out of South Asia.The British colonial government sensed the imminent storm and found it expedient to shift the administrative nerve centre of the empire to the tamer and safer Delhi.The city that was the "second city of the Empire,after London was thus somewhat "relegated in status" but became a beacon for the revolutionary new India. Thanks everyone for the Slideshow and the comments though.

I am no pontificator and Bangalore is my home for what over 70 years.Talk about community service.We have one in our area and we know how difficult it is to get our educated,socially aware and well heeled neighbors to participate.Apathy and indifference is the attitude.
Give every girl in India a chance

comments.userDisplayName: Page3 Columnist From Filthy Indian Daily
comments.commentBody: What is going on..Why is NYT leaving out dainik jagran and punjab kesri.. I guess we will next see news in hindi in NYT... Way to go...

The continued pillorizing Penn State with rediculous articles such as this reach, is doing nothing to resolve any problem.  What does this creative "what if" have to do with the sad situation that has occured and the efforts to get to the truth of responsibility.  I'm truly amazed that the Times would print such make believe.

Wouldn't it make more sense to talk about the rate of warming instead of the total warming? If it is going to warm 3 degrees Centigrade in 30 years, then that would be a major problem. If it is going warm 3 degrees Centigrade in 300 years, then that is a completely different kettle of fish. Frankly, I suspect we are going to be out of fossil fuels within a hundred to one hundred and fifty years without a massive switch to nuclear power. Of course, running out of fossil fuels is a solution to AGW, but probably not the most desirable one. In any case, it doesn't make sense to talk about warming.

Frankly the economic models behind the IPCC predictions are a lot more questionable than the climate models. They want to claim they can predict fossil fuel consumption for the rest of the century. Frankly some of their forecasts can't be reconciled with the amount of coal we have in the ground. Remember the coal is useless is it takes more energy to dig out of the ground and haul it to where we burn it than we get from burning it. In many, maybe even most cases we spend more energy hauling the coal where we are going to burn it than we did to did it up in the first places.
So many more comments don't want to face the probabilities. It's sad.
Carl Pope, the outgoing president of the Sierra Club, sent a long reaction to the post and discussion that I've posted as a separate document via crocodoc.com: http://crocodoc.com/oxdbl2R
Obama/Biden 2012. Go!

Wow, wow, wow.

My Sooner heart is broken once again.

Chokelahoma, "where the wins come right before the pain."
We're running out of worthy opponents to LSU for the BCS Championship at this rate. I propose they play the Indianapolis Colts.

If all Americans could look dispassionately at the plight the country is in we might see some progress towards reducing the deficit, putting people back to work, and providing for the citizens who need help the most. But what do we have? Those who look and see only ways to let the unemployed work it out for themselves (in spite of the need to repair and replace crumbling infrastructure through government money) and those who feel that there is no need to help the less fortunate citizen.
The majority are sacrificed for the few; is that democracy? Maybe the election of 2012 will result in the people's voice being heard.
Like Paladino before him, Gingrich is trying very hard not to be POTUS. Let him off at the next station
A few weeks with no Euro-collapse and you are all wet, but a couple of years with no hyper-inflation and its still right around the corner. Uh-huh.

The fix is in, Doc. Bankers want to own the revenue stream otherwise known as the people. Seen from that admittedly cynical point of view, the illogic disperses. Let's see. Since 2000 we have lost the Bill of Rights and the Magna Carta and the ability to travel domestically in the US without being questioned by a storm trooper demanding to know where we went and why we went there. Who would benefit from that? Only someone who needs a captive market, a revenue stream without any rights. Someone who needs to get in on the ground floor in China, for instance. Someone who cannot prevail without absolute control. Are your papers in order? Current ECB policy is no less irrational than German reparations after WWI. That should tell you something. Where is Mike Royko now that the fix has metastasized?
like the Alexander O'Neal song from the 80's, the Eagles are "Fake"!
The SEC West will have the top 3 teams in the BCS tomorrow night. Roll Tide......

Wow. That's interesting Oregon lost points. How does that happen in a football game?
37-20 USC. Then it's 37-12 after 2 quick Oregon scores. Impressive.

One of the biggest problems with high schools is that they teach little of real, practical value. I was in the honors/AP track all through high school and looking back now, the most valuable class I took at the time was learning how to touch type. Use it every day.

I'm all for an overhaul of the curriculum to include some instruction on basic skills and knowledge: how to deal with an insurance agency, how to handle money (saving, banks, investing), etc. I think a lot of people in this country could use some formal training in these, and parents just don't do it. Frankly, how to have sex would fit in pretty nicely -- it's certainly a topic of major importance.

And it ALL ties in with learning the ability to assess and evaluate information, to examine biases, to see through misinformation and propaganda and come to a rational conclusion.
